snippet: Collin Craig, a former swimmer, complained to the police in January that he had been assaulted and harassed on several occasions, and a university investigation found a hostile environment.
abstract: Western Kentucky University suspends its swimming and diving programs for five years following investigation into hazing, Title IX violations and breaches of student conduct code; follows complaints from former freshman swimmer Collin Craig, who said he had been sexually assaulted and harassed on several occasions; other college sports news noted.
lead_paragraph: Collin Craig, a former swimmer, complained to the police in January that he had been assaulted and harassed on several occasions, and a university investigation found a hostile environment.

headline.main: Western Kentucky Suspends Swim Teams for Five Years
